name: Excel Kata
tagline: Excel column encoding and decoding problem used in coding challenge
body:
## Excel Coding Challenge

In this coding challenge, you will exercise your basic algorithmic skills, your ability to setup a basic webapp and your ability to interact with an external API.

## Background

You know how the columns in spreadsheets are identified by letters? They start with A and go through to Z. And whatâ€™s the column identifier after Z? AA, then AB and so on.

![spreadsheet](images/spreadsheet.png)

The coding challenge is to write two functions. The first will take a positive integer greater than or equal to 1 and return the corresponding spreadsheet column notation. The second will take a string of letters and convert those letters to the corresponding column number.

*Examples*

```
toColNotation(1)		->	A
toColNotation(27)		->	AA
toColNotation(731)		->	ABC

fromColNotation("A")	->	1
fromColNotation("AA")	->	27
fromColNotation("ABC")	->	731
```

## Specifics

To verify the results of your functions, there are two endpoints at your disposal:

```
http://code-challenge.afitnerd.com/v1/excel_kata/to_col_notation/:num
http://code-challenge.afitnerd.com/v1/excel_kata/from_col_notation/:str
```

*Examples*

```
curl http://code-challenge.afitnerd.com/v1/excel_kata/to_col_notation/1
-> {"result":"A"}

curl http://code-challenge.afitnerd.com/v1/excel_kata/from_col_notation/A
-> {"result":1}
```

## App Requirements

1. We should be able to run your code and query your server with:
   * `http://localhost:<port>/wm_code_challenge/to_col_notation/:num`
   * `http://localhost:<port>/wm_code_challenge/from_col_notation/:str`
2. Must communicate with the `code-challenge.afitnerd.com` server to verify your algorithm
3. You may use a web framework of your choice
4. Send over your code and some brief instructions so we can get it up and running locally
5. Send us your code or a link to your repo at: code@afitnerd.com
